business.headline: How infrastructure and innovation are driving India's AI growthAt the India Today AI Summit 2026, industry leaders unpacked what truly powers AI, i.e., from advanced chips and data centres to voice tools and open-source platforms.
India's AI opportunity is real, says OpenAI's chief economist

Inside India's rapid AI rise: Experts talk infrastructure and innovationExperts said that India is on the brink of a major AI expansion. If infrastructure, open technology and user-friendly applications grow together, AI could become part of everyday life for hundreds of millions.

There's real value in AI and India has a real opportunity: OpenAI chief economistAt the India Today AI Summit, OpenAI's Chief Economist Dr Aaron Chatterji said AI is real and accelerating, and India's success will hinge on how fast it invests in skills, infrastructure and trust.

8th Pay Commission WhatsApp scam alert: How employees can stay safeThe 8th Pay Commission matters to more than one crore central government employees and pensioners. It directly affects salaries, pensions and overall financial security. Scammers are exploiting this interest and curiosity to trick people into lowering their guard.
Sensex ends 283 points higher, Nifty above 25,800; IT stocks bleedThe S&P BSE Sensex added 283.29 points to close at 83,734.25, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 93.95 points to end at 25,819.35.

Everyone has a plan for SIPs, but do you know when to stop?Starting a SIP is easy; planning its end is harder. Many investors keep investing on autopilot, without asking an important question, i.e., when should you exit? The answer can shape how effectively your money supports your real-life goals.

Did insurance agent tell you to hide pre-existing disease? It may cost you laterAfter a recent viral dispute over a health insurance claim, questions are being raised about what really leads to claim rejection and has once again brought attention to a common issue in India's health insurance market: non-disclosure of medical history.

PM Modi meets Google CEO Sundar Pichai, discusses deeper AI collaborationPrime Minister Narendra Modi met with Google CEO Sundar Pichai on the sidelines of the India AI Impact Summit and said the discussion centred on strengthening AI cooperation.

Silver jumps over Rs 8,000: Will prices rise again or fade soon?A strong surge in silver has put the metal back in focus. With prices climbing rapidly in a single session, the big question for investors is whether this rise signals a fresh trend or a pause ahead.

Bubble or boom? Experts discuss AI's returns and real-world impactInvestment in artificial intelligence is accelerating rapidly, with billions being poured into data centres and advanced AI models. But as spending rises, one question is gaining attention: how soon will investors begin to see meaningful returns?

Is the AI surge a bubble or a breakthrough? Experts discuss impact and investmentMoney is pouring into artificial intelligence at an unprecedented pace, especially into data centres and large language models. Yet amid the surge in funding, investors are increasingly asking when real financial rewards will follow.

Is AI reinforcing gender inequality more than expected?Ivana Bartoletti, Global Chief Privacy & AI Governance Officer, Wipro, who is also the founder of Women Leading Artificial Intelligence, said the concern goes beyond participation in coding roles.

Ola Electric share price down over 21% in a month: What should investors do?Currently trading near the Rs 28 mark, the counter is hovering close to its recent lows, leaving retail investors wondering whether this is a buying opportunity or a signal to stay away.

How should India build its AI governance? Wipro's AI officer answersDuring a session at India Today AI Summit, Ivana Bartoletti, Global Chief Privacy and AI Governance Officer at Wipro, said governance should not be misunderstood as heavy state control.

Qualcomm bets big on India's AI future with $150 million strategic venture fundWith $150 million on the table, Qualcomm is betting that India's edge AI startups will help define the next global technology cycle, moving intelligence from distant clouds directly into everyday devices.

Still waiting for your income tax refund? Here's what could be holding it upIncome tax refund not credited yet? Before you panic, check the latest processing data and the common reasons that may be holding up your money this assessment season.

Will your PF interest rate increase this year or remain at 8.25%? Check hereFor lakhs of salaried employees, the annual PF interest rate is more than just a number; it shapes long-term savings. With expectations building around this year's decision, many are wondering whether returns will rise or stay unchanged.

India must lean into AI to stay competitive: Hemant TanejaTaneja drew a sharp line between foundational AI research and applied AI. According to him, 2025 was the year AI "diffusion started," with enterprises using AI to boost productivity across departments, from coding to customer support and sales.

Businesses won't be competitive if they don't lean into AI: Hemant TanejaSpeaking at the India Today AI Summit 2026, General Catalyst CEO Hemant Taneja described AI as a "transformative force" and argued that even if the current moment carries elements of hype, it is laying the groundwork for long-term change.

entertainment.headline: British singer Raye apologises after 65 fans denied entry to Paris concert British singer Raye has issued a heartfelt apology after dozens of fans were denied entry to her Paris concert despite holding valid tickets. What went wrong at the Accor Arena?

Saina Nehwal says Shraddha Kapoor is still her top choice if biopic is done again Badminton player Saina Nehwal shared her thoughts on Shraddha Kapoor as her preferred choice for a potential biopic remake. She clarified her rapport with Parineeti Chopra and addressed recent social media buzz.

I don't chase comparisons: Naga Chaitanya on his father Nagarjuna's legacy Naga Chaitanya discusses balancing his father's legacy, fear of repetition, and approach to script selection as he prepares for his 25th film Vrushakarma.

Vir Das mocks Galgotias robodog row, urges fans to adopt 'indie dogs' Actor-comedian Vir Das has weighed in on the Galgotias University robot dog controversy — and his cheeky take is winning the internet. So, what exactly did Vir Das say?

When Anurag Kashyap refused to make Indian version of Money Heist for Netflix Anurag Kashyap revealed he abandoned a Netflix pilot after the streamer pressured him to create an Indian version of Money Heist. The director detailed how the ensuing grief led to a heart attack, severe health complications, and a struggle with lifestyle issues.

Zendaya reveals the relationship red flags she never ignores Zendaya has opened up about the qualities she values in relationships and what she considers warning signs, drawing from her experiences both on and off-screen.

Rana Daggubati reveals why he returned film advances after health scare Actor Rana Daggubati has opened up about his decision to return advances for films he signed before his health issues. He reflected on the impact his physical transformation had on his career and personal identity.

Akshay Kumar admits he's never read a book, says Twinkle Khanna reads one daily Bollywood actor Akshay Kumar recently confessed that he has never read a book, even though his wife, Twinkle Khanna, reads daily. The confession came on the show Wheel of Fortune, which he hosts.

You deserve pyaar: Fans flood Arjun Kapoor's new post with love Arjun Kapoor's latest Instagram post received widespread support and kind words from social media users, in contrast to the negativity he has faced in the past.

BTS J-Hope birthday: Ladies, you don't need a man, all you need is hope J-Hope celebrates his birthday by reaffirming his role as a source of warmth and hope. His music offers fans, especially women, a message of confidence and kindness in a competitive industry.

Rajinikanth's 2014 film Kochadaiyaan gets AI upgrade amid legal row Filmmaker Soundarya Rajinikanth's 2014 animated feature Kochadaiiyaan was reimagined through AI recently. The makers unveiled a new teaser on February 17.

Vivek Agnihotri confirms 'big nationalistic project' amid Op Sindoor film buzz Speaking to India Today, Vivek Agnihotri broke his silence on a "big nationalistic project" amid reports linking him to a film on Operation Sindoor. While he refuses to confirm details, the buzz around the alleged collaboration is growing.

My A1 from Day 1: Vikrant Massey's anniversary wish for Sheetal is pure love Vikrant Massey celebrated his wedding anniversary with Sheetal Thakur on February 18 by sharing personal photos and a heartfelt message, highlighting their journey as a family and reflecting on his recent professional milestones.

Margot Robbie: Make movies for the people buying tickets, not the critics Margot Robbie has said that she focusses on the audience's emotional experience rather than critical approval. She emphasised that films should be made for the people buying tickets.

Blink Twice trends as viewers see Epstein island parallels in film Blink Twice, a thriller set on a billionaire's private island is back in the spotlight as online users spot eerie overlaps with resurfaced Epstein emails. Coincidence or commentary?

56 Days review: Dove Cameron-Avan Jogia serve chemistry in a slick thrillerRelease Date:Wed Feb 18, 2026 56 Day series review: 56 Days is a glossy and slow-burn thriller that thrives on the chemistry between Dove Cameron and Avan Jogia. Is the series, currently available on Prime Video, worth your time? Find out here.

Lokah 2 filming to begin in September, Kalyani Priyadarshan confirms return Work on Lokah Chapter 2 has begun with scripting underway and filming set for September. Kalyani Priyadarshan confirms her role, adding excitement to the sequel's anticipation.

Why women-led films still struggle at box office, and can Assi change the game? We say we want strong women on screen. We praise them, share trailers, write think-pieces. But when Friday arrives, why don't we buy tickets? This is not a question about cinema, it's a question about us.

Lakshmi Manchu says abuse should never be normalised, talks of Taapsee's Thappad While promoting her upcoming film, actor Lakshmi Manchu spoke about shifting attitudes towards relationships, the influence of social media, and her stance on domestic abuse, using the film Thappad as a reference.

general news.headline: Galgotias blames Comms head for robodog row: Ill-informed, not authorised to speakGalgotias University has publicly apologised for misinformation provided by an unauthorised staff member at the recent AI Summit. The university said it is commitment to transparency and has vacated the event premises following the controversy.

Ex-Isro employee kills wife at Karnataka home, wanted to kill himself tooA retired ISRO employee allegedly killed his wife at their residence in Bangalore, with police probing his mental health history. Authorities have registered a murder case and informed the couple's daughter in the US.

At Infosys we were building AI platform 10 years ago, now it is all in past: Vishal SikkaSpeaking at the India Today AI Summit 2026, former Infosys CEO Vishal Sikka on Wednesday revealed that the Indian IT giant could have been a frontrunner in AI if it had persisted with its initial approach.

Weapon more dangerous than warship: Khamenei warns US as nuclear talks continueIran warned the US after deployment of USS Gerald R. Ford, the world's largest aircraft carrier, to the Middle East, where it will join the USS Abraham Lincoln and other American warships already operating in the US Central Command area.

Why Bangladeshis are mocking Tarique Rahman, a 12th pass, as an engineerAfter the BNP's sweeping victory in Bangladesh, the Jamaat-e-Islami and its ally, the NCP, alleged poll engineering and began calling Tarique Rahman an "engineer". Bangladeshis have started flooding social media with memes and jokes, claiming Tarique "engineered" the results in the BNP's favour.

IND vs NED Live: Suryakumar Yadav falls. India lose momentum in middle oversIndia (IND) vs Netherlands (NED) Live Score, T20 World Cup: India (114/4 in 14 ov). Suryakumar Yadav is the latest to fall. He was just starting to get going, but ends up getting trapped at fine leg. Netherlands are ecstatic as they break India's momentum.

Enough of this nonsense: Startup shades Galgotias with made-in-India robodogThe emergence of robots like Param and Svan-2 reflects a broader trend in India's technology sector, where startups and research groups are moving beyond prototypes toward real-world robotic platforms.

Will Muhammad Yunus become Bangladesh President?Earlier, speculation about whether Bangladesh's interim administration chief, Muhammad Yunus, would become the country's next President would have been dismissed outright. But after his National Security Adviser, Khalilur Rahman, was inducted as Foreign Minister into PM Tarique Rahman's BNP Cabinet, the idea couldn't be fully discarded.

Macron shares AI-generated photo with PM Modi: Ready for AI Impact SummitIndia and France have already unveiled plans to establish key collaborative institutions, including the Indo-French Centre for AI in Health, the Indo-French Centre for Digital Science and Technology, and a National Centre of Excellence for Skilling in Aeronautics.

I lied on video: Pak hockey captain spills all about team's horror in SydneyPakistan hockey captain Ammad Shakeel Butt has admitted he lied in a video where he denied the team's ordeal during their recent Australia tour. The players were left without proper hotel accommodation and forced to do daily chores due to mismanagement by the Pakistan Hockey Federation.

Indian dog, go back: Sikh nurse thrashed at Australian gym in racial attackVerbal insults, racist abuse, and a thrashing left a 22-year-old Sikh nurse with a broken nose and trauma from which he is unlikely to recover anytime soon. It comes months after anti-immigration protests swept Australia.

Troubles for Galgotias not over. Soccer drone at AI Summit stirs rowThere seems to be no end to the troubles for Galgotias University. After it was forced to vacate the AI Summit amid a controversy over its Chinese robodogs, the university has now come under scrutiny over a Korean soccer drone that it passed off as its own.

Trisha's stand in Vijay row is a refusal to be patriarchy's political weaponActor Trisha's dignified response to the sexist comment Tamil Nadu BJP chief Nainar Nagendran made in a bid to discredit Vijay has reiterated that a line needs to be maintained between political rivalry and personal dignity.

From 700 in NEET UG to 9 in NEET PG: The great Indian medical merit paradoxA medical graduate scoring just 9 out of 800 in NEET PG and still earning a postgraduate seat has ignited fierce debate.  But, this isn't about one candidate's decline from 700/720 to 9/800. These are different cohorts, different exams, and different stages of training. The paradox lies not in individual collapse, but in a system where entry-level scores cluster at the top while exit-stage scores can fall to single digits.

Gurugram CA kills pregnant banker wife day after celebrating Valentine's DayThe victim, Mehak, a bank manager from Haryana, who had been married for four months, was found dead near a canal after the accused called Dial 112 claiming unidentified men had attacked them.

New CCTV shows Delhi teen speeding SUV seconds before running over bikerA speeding Scorpio SUV in Dwarka fatally hit a 23-year-old motorbike rider, Sahil Dhaneshra, and injured a taxi driver. The juvenile driver has been arrested, and police continue their investigation.

Punjab bride showered with Rs 8.5 crore at wedding? Groom's family denies claimA video from the ceremony in Tarn Taran, which has gone viral, shows the bride standing at the venue as currency notes are showered on her - a customary gesture at many Punjabi weddings.

What happened, happened: Indore man smiles when asked motive for girlfriend's murderA woman's decomposed, naked body was discovered in a rented room in Dwarkapuri, Indore, on February 13 after neighbours reported a foul smell. Police broke open the door and found rope marks on her neck. The accused was arrested the following day.

Did insurance agent tell you to hide pre-existing disease? It may cost you laterAfter a recent viral dispute over a health insurance claim, questions are being raised about what really leads to claim rejection and has once again brought attention to a common issue in India's health insurance market: non-disclosure of medical history.

From Rs 350 crore AI bet to robodog row: The 12-day Galgotias AI spiralGalgotias University announced a Rs 350+ crore AI push days before the AI Impact Summit 2026. At the summit, a Chinese robodog was presented as campus-developed, triggering backlash, late-night clarifications, and reports of eviction. In less than two weeks, a flagship AI showcase turned into a credibility crisis.

Foreign travel blogger reviews Indian Railways meal, says he did not expect thisA foreign travel blogger reviewed a meal served by Indian Railways during his train journey in India. He shared his experience in a post on Instagram.

Thanks for joining movement: Macron backs India's push for social media age curbsFrench President Emmanuel Macron welcomed India's push for stricter online safeguards, as the Centre discussed age-based social media restrictions and tougher deepfake regulations with tech platforms.

Vivek Agnihotri confirms 'big nationalistic project' amid Op Sindoor film buzzSpeaking to India Today, Vivek Agnihotri broke his silence on a "big nationalistic project" amid reports linking him to a film on Operation Sindoor. While he refuses to confirm details, the buzz around the alleged collaboration is growing.

Sudden clearance of 75 school files on day of Ajit Pawar crash sparks rowOpposition leaders have questioned how 75 files could be processed and signed within a short span, especially on a day when the state administration was reportedly preoccupied with the breaking news surrounding Ajit Pawar.

sports.headline: Abhishek Sharma's nightmare T20 World Cup continues with third duck in a row T20 World Cup 2026, IND vs NED: Abhishek Sharma registered his third duck of the competition after being dismissed by off-spinner Aryan Dutt in the Group A clash on Wednesday at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

Ponting slams Australia after shock exit, says they lacked past champions' aura T20 World Cup 2026: Ricky Ponting was heavily critical of the Australian side led by Mitchell Marsh following their shock group-stage exit after losses to Zimbabwe and Sri Lanka.

IND vs NED: Washington Sundar returns, Axar rested for final game before Super 8s T20 World Cup 2026: After winning the toss and choosing to bat first, India's captain, Suryakumar Yadav, revealed that they have made two changes to the side facing the Netherlands at the Narendra Modi stadium in Ahmedabad.

Pakistan bounce back from India debacle, down Namibia to reach Super 8 T20 World Cup, PAK vs NAM: Sahibzada Farhan scored his maiden T20I century as Pakistan qualified for the Super 8 after beating Namibia by 102 runs in their must-win Group A clash on Wednesday in Colombo. Usman Tariq was the pick of the bowlers for Pakistan with figures of 3.3-1-16-4.

IND vs NED Live: Suryakuymar Yadav, Shivam Dube pick up pace India (IND) vs Netherlands (NED) Live Score, T20 World Cup: India (108/3 in 13 ov). Suryakumar Yadav and Shivam Dube now hold the reins of this innings. Both have started to attack after a conservative period. Dube has targetted Ackermann, while Surya is taking on the pacers.

Pak PM steps in after hockey team captain claims team washed dishes in Australia Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has ordered a formal inquiry into the national hockey team's troubled Australia tour. Captain Ammad Shakeel Butt publicly criticised the national federation after videos showed the team was stranded in Sydney. The players were left without proper hotel accommodation and forced to do daily chores during a week-long tournament.

Sahibzada Farhan becomes second Pakistan man to hit a hundred in T20 World Cup Sahibzada Farhan produced a timely and composed century to become only the second Pakistani to score a hundred in the T20 World Cup, guiding Pakistan to 199 for three against Namibia in a must-win match on Wednesday.

Matheesha Pathirana ruled out of T20 WC in huge blow for Sri Lanka before Super 8 T20 World Cup, SL vs ZIM: Sri Lanka batting coach Vikram Rathour confirmed that Matheesha Pathirana has been ruled out of the mega event after sustaining a calf injury against Australia.

Sad news for Namibia: Shaheen Afridi trolled after Pak drop pacer for must-win game T20 World Cup, PAK vs NAM: Shaheen Shah Afridi faced heavy trolling after being left out of Pakistan's must-win clash against Namibia on Wednesday. The left-arm pacer was dropped following his expensive spell against India in Colombo on Sunday.

4 out of 4, India next: South Africa get ready for Super 8, breeze past UAE T20 World Cup 2026: South Africa breezed past the UAE to maintain their 100 percent record in the T20 World Cup 2026 and get ready for the India clash in Ahmedabad. The Proteas won the match by six wickets.

Australia risk missing Olympic berth after group-stage exit in T20 World Cup T20 World Cup: Australia's early exit from the ongoing ICC tournament could cost them a place at the 2028 Summer Olympics in Los Angeles.

Jammu & Kashmir in Ranji final: J&K CM, BCCI chief congratulate team for historic winJammu and Kashmir entered their maiden Ranji Trophy final after defeating Bengal by six wickets in the semifinal on February 18, 2026, drawing congratulations from chief minister Omar Abdullah, BCCI president Mithun Manhas and former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan.

PAK vs NAM highlights: Pakistan into Super 8s with 102 run win over NamibiaPakistan (PAK) vs Namibia (NAM) highlights, T20 World Cup 2026: Usman Tariq finished with a four-wicket haul, taking Pakistan into the Super 8s with a comprehensive 102-run win over Namibia in Colombo.

Vinicius Jr. racism row: What happened in Lisbon during Real Madrid vs BenficaThe Real Madrid-Benfica clash in the UEFA Champions League ended in controversy as Vinicius Jr. alleged that Gianluca Prestianni racially abused him after he got the decisive goal in Lisbon.

Bihar to Dubai via Delhi: UAE star Sohaib Khan's long road to the T20 World CupAfter years of trying to break into India's domestic circuit, Bihar-born Sohaib Khan has finally found his stage. Now a core member of the UAE cricket team, the 27-year-old returned to Delhi and made a mark in the T20 World Cup. Here's his story.

Ranji Trophy: Jammu and Kashmir script history, stun Bengal to reach maiden finalJammu and Kashmir reached the Ranji Trophy finals for the first time in 67 years after defeating Bengal in the semifinal. Auqib Nabi's stunning nine-wicket match haul and their IPL star Abdul Samad's fearless strokeplay ensured their passage into the final.

I lied on video: Pak hockey captain spills all about team's horror in SydneyPakistan hockey captain Ammad Shakeel Butt has admitted he lied in a video where he denied the team's ordeal during their recent Australia tour. The players were left without proper hotel accommodation and forced to do daily chores due to mismanagement by the Pakistan Hockey Federation.

Mohsin Naqvi names real hero behind Pakistan's India match boycott U-turnT20 World Cup: Mohsin Naqvi said that the actual hero behind Pakistan's India match boycott U-turn was Sri Lanka president Anura Kumara Dissanayake and thanked him for his timely intervention.

Muqaddar ka Sikandar: How Raza turned heartbreak into happiness for ZimbabweT20 World Cup: Zimbabwe missed out on qualifying for the tournament in 2024, but this time around, Sikandar Raza's men have secured their berth in the Super 8. It was Raza, with his inspirational leadership and attitude, aims to keep his side grounded and continue their journey towards bigger goals at the T20 World Cup 2026.

PAK vs NAM weather forecast: Will Pakistan suffer Australia's fate?Pakistan takes on Namibia in a crucial Group A fixture at the Sinhalese Sports Club in Colombo, needing a win to stay alive in the T20 World Cup 2026. But will the weather play spoilsport during the contest?

How Dhoni's Biopic sparked Usman Tariq's stunning cricket comebackT20 World Cup: Pakistan's Usman Tariq credited MS Dhoni's biopic for inspiring him to make a comeback in cricket and make his bow in the ongoing T20 World Cup 2026. Tariq has been one of Pakistan's main bowlers during the competition.

IND vs NED: India look to enter Super Eight with a perfect group stage recordT20 World Cup, India vs Netherlands: Already through to the Super Eights, India will look to extend their unbeaten run and cap off their group-stage campaign on a high when they take on the Netherlands at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Wednesday.

Bruised Pakistan hope to avoid Namibian nightmare in must-win gameT20 World Cup: Pakistan play their final group-stage game in the T20 World Cup against Namibia. A loss in this match will mean that Pakistan will get knocked out of the tournament.

No panic in Pakistan camp: Usman Tariq on pressure before must-win Namibia clashT20 World Cup 2026, PAK vs NAM: Speaking to the reporters before Pakistan's must-win clash against Namibia, Usman Tariq opened up on the atmosphere inside the dressing room following the 61-run defeat to India on Sunday.

Babar Azam, Shaheen Afridi under pressure after India debacle? Usman Tariq opens upT20 World Cup, PAK vs NAM: Usman Tariq has backed Shaheen Shah Afridi and Babar Azam to bounce back following their disappointing performance against India, which saw Pakistan suffer a 61-run defeat at the R. Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

Nepal end 4352-day long wait to finish T20 World Cup campaign on a highT20 World Cup, SCO vs NEP: Rohit Paudel's Nepal finished their campaign on a positive note after beating Nepal by seven wickets on Tuesday at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.

India would have beaten Australia had Hardik Pandya played World Cup 2023 final: KaifT20 World Cup: Mohammad Kaif said that Hardik Pandya would have made the difference for India against Australia had he played in the 2023 ODI World Cup. On Tuesday, the Aussies were eliminated at the group stage of the T20 World Cup.

Hope Imran Khan gets the right treatment: Sourav GangulyFormer India captain Sourav Ganguly backed the letter signed by 14 former captains to the Pakistan government, seeking fair treatment for Imran Khan. Ganguly said that Imran put Pakistan on the world map and deserved to be treated well.

Royals seek waiver from state govt to host IPL in Jaipur after safety concernsRajasthan Royals are racing to get their home ground ready for the Indian Premier League and have sought an indemnity waiver from the state government to host matches in Jaipur. The request follows concerns over the venue's readiness raised by an independent auditor and the Board of Control for Cricket in India.

No need to overanalyse Abhishek Sharma's duck against Pakistan: Sitanshu KotakT20 World Cup, IND vs NED: India batting coach Sitanshu Kotak said that there was no need to overanalyse Abhishek Sharma's form in the tournament. Abhishek came back into the line-up after recovering from illness, but got out for a duck against Pakistan.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
